annotations: If the volatility of the stock market has you concerned about your investments , you may want to consider something designed to be a bit more stable .
The stock market 's recent volatility likely has some investors seeking a safe haven .
One way to go is a Real Estate Investment Trust or REAT .
They own and operate apartment complexes and office buildings and other properties .
By law , the trust must pay out 5 % of its taxable income each year and that , in turn , creates big dividends .
The group so far in the third quarter for those companies that have reported have generated about 0 % earnings growth .
We think over the long term , at least for the next couple of years , that many of these companies can have high single digit revenue growth .

So far this return , returns are up more than 15 % , compared to the S-AMP-P 500 's loss of nearly 3 % and the Nasdaq 's loss of more than 15 % , but while REATs offer some stability in a volatile market , there is some risk as well .
You think about real estate , it 's a cyclical industry .
The things that have gotten you in trouble are too much supply .
Demand is relatively stable , but the ups and downs relative to supply were what hurts you in the real estate markets .
Valarie Morris , `` CNN Financial News , '' New York .
For more business and consumer news , click on to cnnfn.com .
